text: Kal Bhairab Temple is a Hindu temple, dedicated to the god Shiva, in the Chittagong division of Bangladesh. The temple is famous for the large linga. It is supposed to be the largest in the world. The goddess Kali is also worshipped there. ==History== The temple dates back to the 19th century. It was damaged by Pakistani soldiers during the Bangladesh Liberation War. ==References== Category:Hindu temples in Bangladesh Category:Chittagong Division
title: Kal Bhairab Temple, Brahmanbaria
